summary: This is a November 24, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting a production of discovery materials. The production includes JPMC (JPMorgan Chase) records and Lockheed Martin records, both designated as confidential under the protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces discovery materials, including JPMC and Lockheed Martin records, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential materials.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced JPMorgan Chase (JPMC) records and Lockheed Martin records as part of discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The produced materials were designated as confidential under a July 31, 2020 protective order, requiring specific handling by the defense.
The letter clarifies that the marking 'confidential' on these documents is related to the court's protective order, not national security classification.
The document shows the ongoing discovery process in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) as of late 2021.
